summary: "The Master and Margarita" is a book by Russian writer Mikhail Bulgakov. Written between 1928 and 1940, it tells the story of the devil, Professor Woland, visiting the Soviet Union. Woland questions people's beliefs and behaviors. The novel is a mix of the supernatural, dark humor, and Christian ideas. It's hard to categorize because it's part true story (autobiographical) and part made-up (fiction). Many people think it's one of the best books from the 20th century and the best Soviet satire.
title: The Master and Margarita
